key_channel_insights.line_content: A substantial 96% of offers are not available on OTA, signaling an extensive gap in this distribution channel.
MSE platforms offered lower prices 22% of the time, showcasing their ability to provide competitive rates.
GDS channels exhibit 97.68% non-availability for Air China's offers, indicating significant inventory gaps.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_title: Most Price Discrepancies Not Available on OTA
ota_highlights.line_content: Overall, offers not found on OTA represent the highest percentage, suggesting a significant portion of itineraries are missing.
Incidences of OTA lower pricing are negligible, indicating competitive pricing generally aligns or exceeds the airline's website.
Data shows minimal fluctuation from last week to previous month, indicating price stability on OTA.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Web Offers Often N/A on OTA
ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Over 96% of offers analyzed were not found on the OTA.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Very Low Incidents of OTA Offering Lower Prices
ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA lower happens in less than 0.1% of cases, reinforcing higher or identical pricing trends.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries have almost 97% offer absence on OTA, indicating a strong need for optimization in this area.
Long-haul shows 83% absence on OTAs, lower than short haul but significant.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Offers originating from CN have a 97% absent rate on OTA, with very low OTA-discounting.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Non-CN Origin More Prone to Price Discrepancies
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA has higher rates for 22% of non-CN origins, indicating a considerable mark-up on international itineraries.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Almost 98% of close-in window offers are not found on OTA, revealing a significant gap.
Far-out itineraries show 94% absence, slightly better than close-in but still considerable.

mse_highlights.line_content: A significant 59.5% of Air China website offers were not available on MSEs last week, highlighting potential distribution gaps.
MSEs offered lower prices than Air China's website in 22% of cases last week, indicating competitive pricing on metasearch platforms.
18.2% of MSE offers matched the airline website's pricing, reflecting consistent price parity.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The non-availability of Air China's offerings on MSEs increased by 25.44% over the previous week, pointing to growing coverage challenges.
MSEs reduced prices compared to the previous week by 20.38%, indicating continued downward pricing adjustments.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: In the short-haul segment, 22.1% of prices were lower on MSEs, with a consistent week-over-week price reduction by 20.26%, indicating sustained competitive pricing.
Despite lower levels of interaction, long-haul saw 20.5% of lower-priced options on MSEs, with a modest price reduction of 21.74% from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For China-origin flights, prices on MSEs were 22.5% lower, a 21.00% reduction from last week, suggesting a stronger competitive positioning in this market.
Only 12.4% of non-China origin flights were priced lower on MSEs, demonstrating lesser pricing advantage and opportunity for growth.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings on MSEs showed a notable 23.4% lower price level than the Air China website, reflecting aggressive last-minute pricing strategies.
Far out bookings were more stable but with 19.1% generally lower prices on MSEs, signaling a consistent yet moderate price advantage.

gds_highlights.line_content: Price offers on Air China's website frequently do not appear on the GDS channel, with a rate of 97.68% as of last week.
Instances where the GDS channel offers higher prices than the website are consistently present, showing relative stability with only minor changes week over week.
The GDS channel rarely features prices lower than the website, with percentages consistently below 0.05%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Approximately 97.68% of the time, GDS does not list the same offers as the Air China website, indicating significant inventory discrepancies.
Instances of GDS offering lower prices than the website are negligible, at below 0.05% of cases.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: The short haul segment mirrors the overall trend with N/A rates reaching 98.27%, indicating unavailable pricing data on GDS.
Higher pricing on GDS for long haul routes stands at 9.28%, reflecting price discrepancies that are more prominent for these routes.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Offers originating from China are predominantly not found on the GDS channel, with a prevalence of 99.49%.
For offers from non-China origins, there is significant disparity with 32.70% instances where the GDS price is higher than the website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking windows experience high N/A rates at 98.74%, showing limited availability of offers on GDS.
Far-out bookings have a slightly reduced N/A rate but also exhibit a 2.02% higher pricing than observed previously, indicating more stability in pricing.
